CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 24, 1955, pg. A14, reads: "Car Caroms Off Pole Into Parlor - Extensive Damage - The wild driver crashed so far into Mrs. Ossie Stevenson's living room at 101 E. Jefferson Street that he and his companion were able to open both front doors and escape though the hole they made in the brick wall.  Mrs. Stevenson's son-in-law, Riley Jones of 1238 Warner Street, is shown surveying the brick and debris an the damage police called 'extensive.'  Occupants of the house, Mrs. Stevenson and her son, Samuel Stevenson, were not hurt.  When the neighbors mentioned calling the police, the driver, and his companion fled and were said to have minor injuries. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Riley Jones standing in pile of bricks and debris after car crashed into home of Mrs. Ossie Stevenson, 101 East Jefferson Street, Northside
